Colgate consumer base
One time buyers
16%		 Loyals
38%		 Switchers
46%
Data source: Spaeth & Hess 1989.
summary_markdown: This table outlines the Colgate consumer base, categorizing it into three distinct segments based on purchasing behavior. The largest segment comprises Switchers, accounting for 46% of consumers, indicating a tendency to move between brands. Loyals represent a significant portion at 38%, suggesting a strong preference for Colgate. The smallest segment consists of One-time buyers, making up 16% of the consumer base, implying infrequent or trial purchases. This data, sourced from Spaeth & Hess in 1989, presents a comparative structure of Colgate's customer demographics, highlighting the relative sizes of these behavioral groups.
